source_notes: Baseline example demonstrating all S5 hotfix rule goals with minimal complexity. Includes preposition trimming, verb-class assignment, noun-governed overrides, span extension, temporal trimming, fictional calendar, and alias propagation.
input_text: On Frostmonth 12, Y149, Professor Harold Finch sent a letter to Hermione Granger at The Great Hall in Cambridge. The inventor, as Dr. H. was known among colleagues, had discovered an anomaly in The Codex of Shadows during his research. Hermione walked to The Great Hall and found the note waiting on her desk. She called Harold immediately. The road leading to Cambridge Observatory was blocked, so she traveled to the library instead. Harold gave a gift to his assistant before departing for Queen's Road.

entities.reasoning: Full name with title; primary entity
Full name; target of communication verb 'sent'
S5.4: Span extension for 'The ...' titles; building/place referent
S5.7: Alias for Harold Finch; epithet
S5.7: Alias for Harold Finch; abbreviated title + initial
S5.4: Span extension for 'The ...' titles; named work/document
S5.7: Alias (first name only) for Hermione Granger
S5.2: Target of motion verb 'walked to'; same entity as E3
S5.1 & S5.7: Preposition 'to' trimmed (appears after 'called'); first name alias for Harold Finch
S5.3: Subject of 'gave' with object 'gift' → noun-governed PERSON bias

relations.head: E1

evidence_span.surface: Professor Harold Finch sent a letter to Hermione Granger at The Great Hall in Cambridge

relations.reasoning: S5.2: Verb-class=communication ('sent a letter') → PERSON↔PERSON bias; S5.3: Noun-governed ('letter') → PERSON target

relations.head: E8

evidence_span.surface: Hermione walked to The Great Hall

relations.reasoning: S5.2: Verb-class=motion ('walked to') → PLACE on object

relations.head: E8

evidence_span.surface: she traveled to the library instead

relations.reasoning: S5.2: Verb-class=motion ('traveled to') → PLACE expected (but 'library' is generic, not tagged)

relations.head: E12

evidence_span.surface: Harold gave a gift to his assistant before

relations.reasoning: S5.3: Noun-governed ('gift') → PERSON target expected; 'assistant' is role, not tagged as entity here

dates.reasoning: S5.5: Temporal preposition 'On' trimmed; S5.6: Fictional calendar normalization

negative_cases.reasoning: S5.1: Preposition 'to' should be trimmed; entity is PERSON 'Hermione Granger' starting at offset 64
Generic common noun with 'the'; no unique referent → do not tag. Only 'Queen's Road' (proper name) is tagged.
Generic common noun with 'the'; no unique referent → do not tag
Role/occupation without proper name → do not tag as entity (could be tagged if system supports ROLE type)
S5.5: Temporal preposition 'On' should be trimmed from DATE span

rule_upgrade_suggestions: S5.1: If preposition ∈ {to, from, with, by} precedes NNP/PERSON → trim preposition from entity span
S5.2: If verb lemma ∈ {send, tell, ask, call, email, write} → bias object toward PERSON
S5.2: If verb lemma ∈ {walk, travel, go, arrive, depart, move} → bias object toward PLACE
S5.3: If governor noun ∈ {letter, note, gift, call, email, memo, message} → bias object toward PERSON
S5.3: If governor noun ∈ {road, path, street, bridge, square, avenue, boulevard} → bias object toward PLACE
S5.4: Extend 'The ...' span to include full NP when head noun ∈ {Hall, Observatory, Archives, Ministry, Library, Museum, Palace, Cathedral, Codex, Chronicle}
S5.5: Trim temporal prepositions {on, during, by, before, after, until, from, since} from DATE/TIME spans
S5.6: Fictional calendar patterns should normalize to structured format: <MonthName>-<Day>-<Year>
S5.7: Alias propagation window ±3 sentences; merge if Levenshtein≤2 and POS pattern matches (e.g., 'Dr. H.' → 'Harold Finch')
Consider role entities (assistant, colleague, professor) if ROLE type is added to schema
